title: Ask a Sona Main - BloodWater - Completed

replies.body: Apparently Riot is looking to tweak Sona a bit (The changes got pulled from the PBE for the time being but are still on the table for a future patch). What kind of changes would you think are most needed / what changes would you personally like to see on her?

I would love to see her get some of her flat health back, and maybe a slight increase in base armor stats. This is because I have played against many Sona players and some of them even end up dying at level 1 because they overextend a lot.

What's your main account's name? Bloodwater in NA hasn't played any sona game this season and only 15 games in s5 (~1% of all ranked games played). Cloudwater only has 1 sona game in the last month. Do you have any recent match history/replay that we can use to improve ourselves? 

It really irks me that you couldn't answer questions about recent changes such as athene builds. I came here with the hope of getting more opinions on build paths. Another top sona main in NA right now is a mid sona main and an ama with that person would have been a lot more interesting. Several other sona support mains would also probably have been more appropriate for this ama.

I'll add in my own little known fact about sona (I'm a D1 sona main myself). If you ever find yourself losing the sustain war in poke lanes, w max can be more mana efficient than q max. Your damage combo is a combination of aa, q empowered power cord, q's buff to the aa and q itself. Of those, 2/4 increase with the lvl of your q. Your sustain comes from w, w's shield and hp/5. Of those, 2/3 increase with the lvl of w. Therefore there's nothing wrong with going qwwqwr in a sustain lane if you'd rather stay topped off (btw I'd like to hear your opinion about skipping e until lvl 8/9 in sustain lanes).

Objectively speaking, the numbers and basic common sense don't support any of your claims:

* Sona is tied with Soraka for the weakest basic attacks of the support class
* Sona has the lowest spell-damage of the entire support class, she's the ONLY support in the game with only 40 base damage
* Sona is one of a very few number of supports that only has 1 damage spell, in spite of it also having the lowest base damage in the game
* Side-by-side comparatively, Sona has the lowest full-damage combo of ANY support champ

I went over this in-depth along time ago, but the numbers from that thread are outdated.  Actually, current-day numbers show an even wider damage gap between Sona and other champs:

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/AUHkJgo5-the-support-class-a-side-by-side-comparison

Thresh is immobile?  I assume you've never read Thresh's kit or else you wouldn't be making this completely false claim.  I'll help you out by informing you of Thresh's abilities, since it's clear you've never played Thresh before:

* Death Sentence:  Thresh hooks a target; reactivate this spell to pull himself to that target.  Range:  1100 units
* Dark Passage:  Thresh throws his lantern up to 950 units so he can pull an ally to him to a max range of 1500 units away.

Fact of the matter is Sona is the weakest support in the game.  Has been since Gutting 4.13 and will continue to remain so until she's reworked or reverted.

Why do you like the traditional support build over the more AP lichbane build on Sona?  There are items like {{item:3116}} if you think you need HP.

I prefer the traditional support build on Sona because most enemy teams run a greater amount of magic damage compared to physical. In that sense, I prefer to stack as much health and magic resistance as I can, instead of going for AP items. I also value items such as aegis of the legion more than AP ones. Against physical based damage teams, I would build Frozen Heart, and most likely get AP items afterwards.

Having said that, would it interest you to know that after excluding Spellblade and Echo games of Sona, her winrate in Diamond falls all the way to ~28%?  With this FACT in mind, do you still continue to believe she can function without artificial numbers from items?
